Description: Marble stela inscribed with twelve lines of Greek text containing a dedication to Ares by Alexandros, son of Syndaios, on the occasion of his party's elephant-hunting mission. Dated to the reign of Ptolemy IV Philopater, his wife Arsinoe and their son, who later reigned as Ptolemy V Epiphanes.
Bibliographic references: Inscription / The Collection of Ancient Greek Inscriptions in the British Museum (1064)
Associated names: Named in inscription: Ptolemy IV Philopator
Acquisition name: Purchased from: R J Moss & Co
